Feature:Embedded one to one references can be included and excluded
Initial Setup
Initialize Known Assessment Data for Get Requests
The Read content type can include embedded one to one references
The Read content type can include embedded one to one references

exec: pm.test("Should the item return contain the embedded object ContentStandard", () => {

request.description:
Scenario: The Read content type can include embedded one to one references
    Given the caller is using the "Assessment-Readable-Includes-Embedded-Object" profile
    When a GET (by id) request is submitted using raw JSON to assessments with an accept header content type of the appropriate value for the profile in use	
    Then the response should indicate success
    And the response should contain the embedded object ContentStandard

item.description:

    When a GET (by id) request is submitted using raw JSON to assessments with an accept header content type of the appropriate value for the profile in use	
    Then the response should indicate success
    And the response should contain the embedded object ContentStandard

A GET request is made with a write only profile

exec: pm.test("Should return the item with The allowed methods for this resource with the 'Test-Profile-Resource-WriteOnly' profile are PUT, POST, DELETE and OPTIONS. string", () => {
pm.expect(responseItem.message).to.include("The allowed methods for this resource with the 'test-profile-resource-writeonly' profile are PUT, POST, DELETE and OPTIONS.");

request.description:
Scenario: A GET request is made with a write only profile
    Given the caller is using the "Test-Profile-Resource-WriteOnly" profile	
    When a GET (by id) request is submitted to schools with an accept header content type of the appropriate value for the profile in use
    Then the response should contain a 405 Method Not Allowed failure indicating that "The allowed methods for this resource with the '{profile}' profile are PUT, POST, DELETE and OPTIONS."

request.description:
Scenario: The Write content Descriptor filters a child collection to only include certain Descriptor values and non-conforming values are supplied
    Given the caller is using the "Test-Profile-Resource-Child-Collection-Filtered-To-IncludeOnly-Specific-Descriptors" profile
    When a PUT request with a collection containing only non-conforming included Descriptor values is submitted to schools with a request body content type of the appropriate value for the profile in use
    Then the response should contain a 400 Bad Request failure indicating that "the value of {suppliedValue} supplied for the {property} of the {entity} does not conform with the filter values defined by profile {profileName}"

request.description:
Scenario: The Read content type filters a child collection to only exclude certain Descriptor values
    Given the caller is using the "Test-Profile-Resource-Child-Collection-Filtered-To-ExcludeOnly-Specific-Descriptors" profile
    When a GET (by id) request is submitted to schools with an accept header content type of the appropriate value for the profile in use
    Then the response should indicate success
    And the response model's collection items should not contain items matching the excluded Descriptor values

item.description:

    Given the caller is using the "Test-Profile-Resource-Child-Collection-Filtered-To-ExcludeOnly-Specific-Descriptors" profile

item.name: The Write content Descriptor filters a child collection to only exclude certain Descriptor values and only conforming values are supplied

request.description:
Scenario: The Write content Descriptor filters a child collection to only exclude certain Descriptor values and only conforming values are supplied
    Given the caller is using the "Test-Profile-Resource-Child-Collection-Filtered-To-ExcludeOnly-Specific-Descriptors" profile
    When a PUT request with a collection containing only conforming excluded Descriptor values is submitted to schools with a request body content type of the appropriate value for the profile in use
    Then the response should indicate success
    And the submitted Descriptor values should be persisted to the School
    And the pre-existing Descriptor values should be intact on the School

# Write, Exclude Descriptors, Non-conforming
Scenario: The Write content Descriptor filters a nested child collection to only exclude certain Descriptor values and non-conforming values are supplied
    Given the caller is using the "Test-Profile-Resource-Nested-Child-Collection-Filtered-To-ExcludeOnly-Specific-Types-and-Descriptors" profile

    When a PUT request with a collection containing only conforming excluded Descriptor values is submitted to studentAssessments with a request body content type of the appropriate value for the profile in use

    Given the caller is using the "Assessment-Readable-Includes-Embedded-Object" profile
    When a GET (by id) request is submitted using raw JSON to assessments with an accept header content type of the appropriate value for the profile in use	
    Then the response should indicate success
    And the response should contain the embedded object ContentStandard

item.description:
Scenario: The Write content Descriptor filters a nested child collection to only exclude certain Descriptor values and only conforming values are supplied
    Given the caller is using the "Test-Profile-Resource-Nested-Child-Collection-Filtered-To-ExcludeOnly-Specific-Types-and-Descriptors" profile
    Given the caller is using the "Test-Profile-Resource-Nested-Child-Collection-Filtered-To-ExcludeOnly-Specific-Types-and-Descriptors" profile
    When a PUT request with a collection containing only conforming excluded Descriptor values is submitted to studentAssessments with a request body content type of the appropriate value for the profile in use
    Then the response should indicate success
    And the submitted Descriptor values should be persisted to the StudentAssessment
    And the pre-existing Descriptor values should be intact on the StudentAssessment

item.name: Clean Up Test Data
Clean up Environment Variables

exec: // Assumes Environment with Environment Variables: ApiBaseUrl, ApiKey, ApiSecret

// See https://gist.github.com/blmeyers/21138bbe6f80b8c35701a8754bfe59d5 for an environment sample for Local (NOTE: environment variable names have been changed from the gist -- you must adjust accordingly)
// Handles auto refreshing based on provided expiration, but doesn't handle the token being revoked early
// If stuck with "Bad Token" or "Not Authenticated", just delete the Token or TokenExpiry variables to force a new token
console.log('Token or expiry date are missing, retrieving new token')
console.log('Token is expired, retrieving new token')
// console.log('Token and expiration date are still valid');
